titlestmt.titleproper: Brookline, Mass. Leyden Congregational Church records, 1895-1975.
titlestmt.author: Rebecca Arabian

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday December 18, 2025 at 14:15

did.unittitle: Brookline, Mass. Leyden Congregational Church records, 1895-1975.
did.abstract: The Leyden Congregational Church in Brookline, Massachusetts was incorporated on November 24, 1896, with the cornerstone for the church building at 1835 Beacon Street having been laid on May 19, 1899. The Church eventually closed in 1975, after nearly eight decades of serving its neighboring community. This collection contains records on the committees and organizations, history, administration, building and finances, and church life of Leyden Congregational Church.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Brookline, Mass. Leyden Congregational Church records, 1895-1975, RG0701. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated to the Congregational Library & Archives by the Congregational Christian Historical Society in 1975; no accession number.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed in April 2025 by Rebecca Arabian.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Leyden Congregational Church in Brookline, Massachusetts was incorporated on November 24, 1896, with the formal organization of the church and installation of Dr. Harris G. Hale as pastor having taken place on November 4 of that year. For three years, services were held in the Beaconsfield Casino. The cornerstone for the church building at 1835 Beacon Street was laid on May 19, 1899, and the first morning worship took place six months later.

The building was restored in the late 1920s after a fire damaged the House of Worship. Still, the Church and its community celebrated many joyous events and occasions, including its 50th and 75th anniversaries. Beyond the administration of the Leyden Congregational itself, the Church led various organizations and committees. This included the Woman's Union, which was comprised mostly of women members of the Church. The Union carried out missionary and charity work, impacting the local and the international.

During its time, Leyden Congregational Church voted to ratify the "Basis of Union" in 1937 and joined the United Church of Christ in 1962. Leyden Congregational Church eventually closed in 1975, after nearly eight decades of serving its neighboring community. Today, the building at 1835 Beacon Street is occupied by the Chinese Christian Church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains records on the administration, building, and finances of Leyden Congregational Church, including those from the Church's treasurer and Board of Trustees. The collection also holds records on church life and history, which feature a scrapbook as well as materials on the Church's 40th, 50th, and 75th, anniversaries. Finally, in this collection there are records on the committees and organizations associated with Leyden Congregational, such as their Woman's Union.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into five series. The second and third series have been further arranged into three and six sub-series, respectively. Records in each series and sub-series have been arranged by topic and in chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from various organizations within and connected to the Leyden Congregational Church, including the Building Committee, Church Committee, Church Council, Ecclesiastical Council, Music Committee, Prudential Board, and Woman's Union.

did.unittitle: Copy of Ecclesiastical Council meeting minutes
Woman's Union and Mary Crosby records
Woman's Union and Mary Crosby records

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records on the anniversaries and history of Leyden Congregational Church, as well as books of remembrance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains a scrapbook and other records on the history of Leyden Congregational Church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains records and correspondence pertaining to the 40th, 50th, and 75th anniversaries of the Leyden Congregational Church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains books of remembrances from the Leyden Congregational Church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains annual reports, bylaws and their proposed revisions, and records pertaining to the Board of Trustees, clerks, and ministers of the Leyden Congregational Church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains membership records from the Leyden Congregational Church, beginning in 1896.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection of membership cards ends in 1974. A start date is unknown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection of membership cards starts in 1975. An end date is unknown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains annual reports for the Leyden Congregational Church from 1897 to 1973.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains clerk's records from the Leyden Congregational Church from 1924 to 1967.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains ministerial records from the Leyden Congregational Church as well as records from the Old South Church in Boston, Massachusetts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains meeting minutes, records, and correspondence from the Board of Trustees of the Leyden Congregational Church, as well as records on the New Perspectives School.

did.unittitle: Board of Trustees Treasurer's Bonds records
Board of Trustees Heating Equipment records
Board of Trustees House Committee records
Board of Trustees and Town of Brookline correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains the bylaws and proposed revisions of the bylaws of the Leyden Congregational Church from 1931 to 1966.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains building and finance records for Leyden Congregational Church. These records include a an article of the restoration of the church building, a copy of the church charter, deeds, treasurer reports, and trust funds.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains a report from the Choral Club, parish correspondence, an obituary on former minister Harris G. Hale, and canvassing records of the Leyden Congregational Church.
